The farmer class is an eternal class because cultivation is inevitable for the human society and for this work only farmers could be believed .

Eventually , why socialism and communism had become this much popular , and suddenly why did it become this much unfaithful ?
Because , socialism based on Marxism had been agrounded on capitalism and centralization .
Where ever it was followed , there it started to create regional inequality , the inequality of the village-town .
To hide these inequalities the need of the dictatorship never finished .
Marxists has forecasted the crisis of the capitalism repeatedly , but every time , capitalistic nations overcome from those crises .
It used to seem from that capitalism can face every crisis .
Now it is not going to happen .
Now every country is becoming capitalistic .
India , Republic of the Soviet Union , all the countries of the Eastern Europe- All have become capitalistic .
In all these countries , in two-three decades crises are going to come , capitalism will not be able to face those .
The real crisis of the capitalism is not the lack of the spending capacity of the factory labors , like how communists have been wishing ; but the real crisis of the capitalism is the lack of the capital .
This capital is the production of exploitation .
From the fall of the communism , this process has got the immediate shock , because capitalism has become contesantless .
Its alternative is not seen by the people .
But in the long term thought this will be seen that from the fall of the communism this process will become rapid , because communism is a disguised form of the capitalist production system .
Now in all these countries , the bare capitalism is being examined .
First time , at the big level and in all the important countries the pure capitalism is being used , in that there is no support of the outer colonies .
To get the conquest on the coming new turn , Indian farmers will have to prepare from now itself .
Since this preparation will be the preparation for an era-change , which is not less important than any great revolution , it is the need for the Indian farmers that they adopt the broad tactics .
Keeping front the alternative economic policy to oppose strongly the ' new economic policy ' will be the first step of the farmer politics .

in the country like India the legal equality of the farmer and capitalist will be proved against the capitalistic system , because for the capitalists farmers are such a huge community who after growing the raw material give in cheap and purchase the industrial products on very high price .
In the ratio the labor is bought from the capital in that respect a farmer of the five acre is also an exploiter .
Reason , he is an owner of a small capital of the exploitative system .
If big capitalists were not there , then small capital would not have been the source of the exploitation .
In the land system there will not be big plowes , then the farmer will not be a exploitative class .
But this is a fact that big land owner is leading the small farmer .
When a political movement will start , then we may comment on his class character .
In the camp of the six independent organisations who did the public movements till past 11 to 14 March , an important talk occurred .
The matter of the discussion was the farmer movement and between the agriculture movement how will the abatement and solution of the internal conflict happen ?
The leaders of both the movements were arguing .
They decided that the summary of the Bhuvaneshwar communication will be broadcasted for the broad discussion .
Thus , it will be a national debate .
For the conservative and rhetorician leftists yet the problem of the farmers is negligible or inferior .
But in the Russia and China , where successful strategies for the movement had been made , farmers and labors had been given the equal importance like the factory workers .
Lenin and Mao in his principal statements kept assuming the revolutionary power to the factory labor , but in practicality and strategy kept moving with taking along the farmers also .
In fact , on the basis of his behavior he did not do the experiment on his principals or fundamental thoughts and the scientific work of the research .
Before the year 1905 it was the opinion of the Russian communists that it is a waste of the time to go to villages .
But after the movement of the 1905 in the strategy of the Lenin the importance of the farmers had started to increase .
Immediate after the revolution of the year 1917 ( in the party congress of 1918 ) Lenin had strongly advocated this that to fight against the colonalisation and formation of the socialism the coalition of the farmer is inevitable .
' The workers of the factories will revolt on his their own power ' such kind of demonstration may be done by quoting the Marx and Anglas .
But just on the basis of the power of the villager landless labors any communist revolution may occur , claim of it is not contained in any leftist science .
Thus , about the revolutionary role of the organisation of the factory labors of the India ( Trade Union ) who have doubts in their mind , it becomes necessary for them that they find the support of the other village class anticapitalist power with the landlesse .
Those people who organise the labors they are not aware about the revolutionary role of the farmer organisations .
There are two reasons behind this .
First this that their mentality is of the trade union , not of the revolution .
They have not made any such list yet that to weaken and abolish the present capitalist-socialist system , the support of which classes is needed .
At this time , how many big organisations of the farmers are there in the countries they all are running their movement in the structure of the trade union .
When they will think of the reformation of the villages of the whole India or will like to reform the whole country , when they will try to give their option then would be able to take more positive attitudes toward labors .
The speaker of the Student struggle brigadier , Mr. Priyadarshi has an important pleading that this is an extension of the farmer movement itself .
We will understand this pleading when would see the movements of the agricultural labors and landless which are running since post independence as the movement of the village 's problem .
During those days , landlords and big land owners were the main exploiters hence for the freedom of the village people to start the struggle against them was the main issue of the leftist movement .
The Malbari silkworm can be cultivated in various climate conditions and the soil of the broader area .
By adopting the better methods itself the good yielding of the cocoon can be obtained .
But for this , it is essential condition to have a leaf of a better variety which gives more production .
The upbringing of the silk worm happens in five different steps during the larva period .
During larva period it is kept in especially made silkworm rearing shed .
Simultaneously , to obtain the high quality silk , arrangement at the proper time and deep care is taken .
During the whole nourishing period the silkworms are taken care very carefully and for their food the better quality of the mulberry leaf is used .
The formation of the better environment and prevention from the worms and diseases are the necessary conditions in their upbringing .
To provide the favorable conditions there is the need of the rearing house and rearing equipments and instruments separately .
In a year , 5 to 10 crops are nurtured and the life span of every crop is 70-80 days .
The mulberry variety : - V-1 and S-36 are the variety which gives production and are very useful for the silkworm nurturing .
These two varieties provide the nutrients which are very essential for the larva in the silkworm rearing .
The S-36 variety-its leaves are heart shaped thick and shining with the light green color .
In the leaves there is high humidity and in that there are more nutrients .
Every year on an acre about 15 thousands to 18 thousand kilo gram mulberry leaves is obtained .
V-1 Variety- this variety is quite popular in the cultivation which was started in the year 1997 .
Leaves are oval shaped , huge sized , thick , deep coloured containing dampness .
In a year , almost 20-24 thousand kilo gram mulberry leaves can be obtained .
Planting method : - the arrangement of the plantation of the tree is done in the two rows where the distance of ( 90+150 cm )  90cm or 60cm  60cm is proper .
Due the presence of space between the double row inter agriculture activity and for the transportation of leaves power tiller may be used .
Through this there is the facility of the drip irrigation .
In every acre , trees can be planted in more number .
Leaves can be taken easily and quickly , which reduce the possibility of the humidity loss .
40 percent labor is saved by shoot harvesting .
Every hectare from the rate of the 8 metric tons , use dungs two times in two years .
For the mulberry K V-1 variety use NPK at the rate of 350:140:140 kilogram per hectare and for the variety of mulberry S-36 at the rate of 300:120:120 kilogramper hectare every year by distributing in five equal parts .
Irrigation : irrigation in the rate of 80 to 120 millimeters in a week .
In the condition when there is the lack of the water farmers can save 40 percent of the water by using drip irrigation .
Hybridized silkworm : - Under the IVLP CSR-2 X CSR-4 and the a double hybrid ( Krishna Raja ) developed bivoltain hybridized silkworm has been recommended .
Caterpillar rearing : - From the hatching of eggs to reach to the mature stage a silkworm has to pass through the five stages .
The second stage of the worms is called youth stage or catterpillar stage .
Since , this is more sensitive to the adverse circumstances and it has more possibility of being infected hence for the nurturing of youth there is the need to provide especial attention .
Hence , in the youth rearing centers in the controlled circumstances , it should be tried to obtain the nurtured silkworms .
Nurturing in the old age : - the rearing of the old age worms start in the third instar .
These are the worms which eat more leaves .
Rearing center : - the rearing of the mulberry silkworm is a home business completely .
For this there is the need of the temperature between 24-28 degree Celsius the climate of the 70-80 percent humidity .
Thus , to maintain the cheap cool environment the especial attention should be given to the selection of the proper material for the building of the wall and roof , the convergence of the building , building methods , design , etc .
Later , for the keeping of the leaves , youth rearing , mature stage rearing and molting enough space should be there .
Simultaneously , the cleanliness of that place and disease free arrangements also should be proper .
According to the type and quantity of the rearing the size of the rearing house should be there .
For 100 DFL the area of 400 square feet surface may be provided ( DFL-disease free laying ) , 1DFL=500 larva ) .
Rearing equipments : - the mature stage silkworms do not bear high temperature , high humidity and minimal air ventilation arrangement .
Hence , to maintain the room temperature at the minimum level there should be two sided air ventilation in the rearing house thus the huge amount of gas which is produced by the sewage released by silkworms can be passed easily .
To cure from the disease : - to keep the rearing house and instruments infection free , it should be cleaned two times .
First time just after the preparation of the preceding crops from the 5 percent bleaching powder and second time the two days before the second crop with 2.5 cenetic ( clorinedi-oxide ) should be cleaned properly .
Shoot nurturing-an economical solution : - in this method of the sericulture nurturing of the last three stages is done by giving the mulberry shoot instead of a free leaf .
This is the most economical method of the nurturing , from that about 40 % of the nurturing labor is saved .
After becoming the number of the silkworm less there is the lack of the spread and infection of the disease .
Just by removing insects and leaves from the process secondary infection reduces .
In the storage and condition of in the bed the better preservation of the leaves .
Nourishment : - start nourishment of the 50-55day old shoots .
Do its cutting in the cool weather of the morning at the height of 3-4feets .
The nourishment of the 60-65 days old shoot should be done with the silkworms of the fifth stage .
The storage of the harvested shoot should be done in the loose vertical position in the environment with cold and humidity , which are covered from the clean , disease free and wet cloths .
For the Bi Voltain Silkworm there is the need of the 460 kilograms in the fourth stage and 2880 kilograms in the fifth stage .
Do not make them eat beige and more ripen leaves .
During every nourishment in the bed distribute the larva in the equal form .
In India there are all of the total 34.43 crore cattles .
Among them , 22.84 crore cow-buffalo , 50 lakh pigs and 34 lakh animals of the horse , donkey , ass and camel family .
Beside them there are 11.49 crore hens also .
The number of the animals of the family of the cow and buffalo , which are found in the India is the 20 percent of the world 's estimated 111.5 crore animals .
Even having this many animals , among those about 50 % animal of buffalo family , 20 % animal of cow family and 16.7 % goats are included .
The production of the milk in the India is just 1.19 crore tons .
Here , the average use of the milk per person is just 130 gram per day .
Whereas , this quantity is 741 grams in Switzerland , 637 grams in New Zealand 623 gram in America and 509 grams in England .
This average of the world is 303 gm , in comparison of the other countries the milk production capacity of the Indian animals is very less .
The Indian cow gives average 173 kg in a year .
Whereas , the cow of the Denmark gives average milk 3,710 , of the Switzerland 3 , 250 , of the America 3 , 280 and of the England 2 , 900 kg .
The condition of the other varieties is followed though from perspective of the number of the lambs India has fifth position in the world .
But in that the production of the wool is very less , also the wool obtained from them are mostly of lower quality .
This is with hair and rough and is not good enough to knit the good cloths .
In India the yearly average production of the wool per lamb is just 700 gm , whereas lambs of some foreign breed variety in a year give 5 to 7 kg wool even .
Insofar there is about the meat production the average body weight of the Indian lamb is from 25 to 30 kg , whereas , the foreigner lambs are three times heavier than these .
Insofar there is the matter of the poultry husbandry in comparison of the other country in India on the basis of the population very less hens are reared .
On every 100 persons , 540 in Denmark , 373 in Canada , 286 in America , 179 in England and from 150 to 200 birds are reared in other European countries .
Whereas in India just 26 hens are reared per 100 people .
An Indian hen gives average 60 eggs in the complete year .
Whereas , the average yearly production of the hens of the species White Legharn and Road Ireland of the America are 193 and 212 eggs .
This number of the country is less than the half of the world 's average number of the year ( 130 eggs ) .
In India this time , 12 eggs per person per year are available .
Whereas , this number is 295 in America , 282 in Canada and 249 in West Germany .
In India , animals are reared in different kind of adverse climate and environmental conditions .
Here the animal husbandry business is in the hands of small farmers , among them maximum farmers adopt it as a supportive occupation with their main occupation agrictulere .
Normal farmer run their living by putting 2-3 animals in the land less than 3 hectare in the small farms , in the some countries of the Europe in the average huddle the number of the animals is more than 30 .
Hence , it is clear that having the number of animals so high even , in the economy-system of the country the contribution of the livestock is not according to its number .
11.83 % income of the total national income is obtained by the livestocks .
The total anticipated income which is obtained from the animal products in 1960-61 was 1,529.72 crore rupees .
From that , Rupees 988.34 crore from the milk and the products made from the milk , Rupees 120.01 crore from meat and meat products , Rupees 42.8 crore from skin and leather , Rupees 66.91 crore from hens and eggs , Rupees 12.74 crore from wool and hairs , Rupees 262.8 crore from dung and Rupees99.11 crore income had been obtained .
In India , the 18.3 percent of the main income by the agriculture is obtained by the livestocks .
Looking at the such a huge number of the animals this contribution is quite less .
In its comparison this income is 82 % in Denmark , 81 % in the Ireland , 79 % in Sweden , and 78 % in the every country of the England and Norway .
In India there is the cow and buffalo family animals in the huge number .
According to the animal census of the 1961-62 the animals of the cow and buffalo family is 111.5 in the whole world and 22.68 crore in the India ( 20.35 % ) but the the production value of the animal-bussiness is not according to this huge number of the animal .
According to the reformed statistic of the statistic department of the administrative secretariate in 1960-61 , as the form of the money its anticipated contribution was 1160 crore .
In the rural economy of the India the contribution of the animals is important .
Even today for the agriculture work the mandatory power is gotten from the oxen itself and the main source of the protein in the maximum people 's food is milk .
Oxen are used for the tilling , digging , harvesting of the crop , threshing , for irrigation and to transport the agricultural products to the market etc . many works .
Beside that animals make the land fertile by their dung compost and also provide skin and leather .
Hence , in India , cows and oxen have been considered the foundation of the agriculture .
The animal - industry has spread in the whole country in the numerous small units , hence to do its right evaluation is very tough .
In Indian agriculture in the form of animal labor , there is an important contribution of the livingstocks .
The anticipated price of this labor in the agriculture will be 300 to 500 crore rupees .
To increase the fertility of the land from animal almost material of 270 crore rupees is gained .
In Indian animals there is more immunity power against the anavavashti , animal-plague and the diseases due to ticks .
Thus , they have very good value in the foreign market .
Due to this , European cattlemen used Indian cattle ( JU animals ) to crossbreed their animals .
Hence better animal can take birth .
The ancestor of the Indian native cow-animals have not been discovered yet and their fossils have not been found yet .
The milch animals of India become savage often , rearing of the cow-animals is considered here very prestigious occupation and milk , butter , paneer and etc . materials obtained by them are used by the people of the every class .
According to the animal-census of the 1961 , in India , there were 8.04 crore animals of the cattle family for 15.23 crore hectare agriculture land .
51 Crore cows of the age more than three years and 2.423 Crore buffalo had been kept for reproduction and milk-production .
Among them , 2.07 crore cows and 1.25 crore buffalo used to produce milk and the rest were either drained or had not reproduce once even .
During the period of 1961-1966 , no any difference occurred in the number of the animals of the cattle family .
During this period , in the number of the animals of the buffalo family has been increased just 32 % .
The number of the cattles is 116 in average of the per 100 hectare agricultural area and this is 61 in Punjab , 283 in Maharashtra and Gujarat , 188 in West Bengal , and 162 in Orisa .
There is quite a difference in the physical structure and frame of the cow animals of India .
Due to that reason , they have become compatible to the climates which is found in different parts .
The animals here either make themselves compatible to the local climate and soil , or grow properly there , where they are taken birth and nurtured .
The native and the cows which give less milk is found in Punjab , Rajasthan , Gujarat , some parts of Maharashtra , Tamilnadu , Mysore and eastern part and coastal areas of the Andhra Pradesh .
Thus , in Assam , West Bengal , Odisa and Kerela the low-grade animals are found .
In the mountain area where it rains heavily .
Dr. Kapil is the best doctor of the veterinary hospital .
Daily a lot of ill animals come to him .
Some are suffering from one disease , some are suffering from another disease .
Looking at such animals he feels very sorry .
Simultaneously , he feels pity on the owners of these animals .
One day a very painful event occurred .
A buffalo died in the campus of the hospital .
His master started to cry badly like any relative of his has passed away .
Doctor Sahab went near to him and consoled him .
Asked the reason of his grief .
He told that he is a poor farmer .
From that the needs of the family was not met .
By doing labor he used to run his house .
By taking debt , he had bought this buffalo so it will be easy to run the family expenditure by selling the milk of the buffalo .
Doctor sahab felt very sorry after listening the inecdote of the farmer .
At that time in front of his eyes the face of such lakh helpless farmers and animal owners were come .
He decided in his mind itself that going village to village , he will give the essential information related to animal-husbandry .
This news was conveyed by the advertisement in nearby villages and the city that the doctor Kapil of the government hospital will give different information about the animal husbandry in the school of the village .
Many farmers from the nearby villages and those who run the oxcart in the city and dairy owners came and sit in the school before the arrival of the doctor sahab .
You all know this , that cow , ox , buffalo etc . animals are how important for you people .
These animals are the best medium for the cultivation of the farmers .
The support of the living of many unemployeds .
Actually , for your growth it is necessary that your animals are healthy , are strong .
If your animals will be healthy , then more work could be taken from them .
Milch animals will give more milk .
No money will have to spend on their sickness .
For their treatment they will not have to wander here and there .
Hence , I will tell you few such things , from that your animal could be prevented from the disease .
Among you all , perhaps very few people would be knowing that a huge reason for the disease of the animal is the small and dirty shelter of the animals ( place to live ) .
Always the shelter of the animals should be built in the way that they should not have any kind of problem .
If one-two animals are there , their shelter can not be arranged separately , then they should be kept in the corner room of the house .
The path to go and come for animals should be one side , thus the whole house would not get dirty from their coming-going .
If there are 8-10 animals or more than this , then their shelter for them should be away from the home .
If there would be pasture and pond also near the cattle house , then it is very good .
But it is not good to make cattle-shed near the dirty drainage .
The place where animals stay whether is cemented of earthen- in that there should be arrangement of air , sun , light and clean water .
According to the place the facet of the cattle shed may be kept in two directions .
One to the east-west , and another to the north-south .
Having facet toward east-west , the animals remain prevented from the hot wind in summer and from cold wave in the winter .
From the north-south facet sun remains for long time in the cattle-shed .
The floor and walls remain dry .
In fact , whatever the facet would of the cattle-shelter , there should be proper sun , air and light in that .
The height of four feet is appropriate for the four walls of the cattle shed .
Inside the four walls there should be high , dense and shady trees .
Plant the trees which leaves does not harm animals .
There should be room to prevent animals from deep cold , hot and rain .
In that for every animal there should be 8 feet long and 6 feet broad place .
By making the different pattern its polish could be reduced .
The floor made of bricks and cement is also good .
Ash or sandy soil should be spread on the earthen floor , ash or soil absorbs the urine of the animal and the sitting place of the animal does not become wet .
This ass should be put daily morning in the pit of the compost , thus any kind of dirtiness did not remain in the animal shed .
The height of the room of the animals should be ten to fifteen foot .
Walls are either earthen or cemented , but there should not have whole and pit in those .
In these pits there is fear to emerge many kinds of poisonous animals , animal could die if they bite .
Interrupting meanwhile a farmer said , Doctor Sahab , is it necessary to have a window or ventilation in the cattle sheds ?
There is life in animals also .
They also have the same need of sun , air and light to be healthy how much we all need .
In sun and light , bacteria of any kind of the disease can not grow .
Thus , how much the arrangement for pure air to come in and impure air to go out will be there , the suffocation will be that much less .
Animals remain happy in the pure and fresh air .
Any kind of the disease can not happen to them .
Thus , it is necessary to have windows and ventilation in the cattle sheds .
For every animal there must be a window in the room .
Looking at the length and width of the room there should be many ventilation in the room .
If fix the iron net in the ventilation then it is good .
In the very cold weather , windows are closed during day and night and ventilations remain open .
Through this , fresh air keep on coming to the room and cold waves does not touch animals also .
If the roof of the animal-shed can be made cemented , then it is good .
Otherwise sheets of the cement or roof of the tiles is good .
Never use tin sheets as the form of roof , because tin roof becomes more hot in the sun and very cold during the night of the cold .
Due to this there is fear that animal will feel more hot during hot weather and cold during cold weather .
If the cattle shed is earthen then wall must be whitewashed two-three times in a year .
Once before the rain , it is necessary to whitewash .
We also want to know this , that should the arrangement of feeding the animals fodder be in that room or some where else ?
Actually matter is this that if you have enough space , then arrangement to feed the animal should be some where else .
In place of the fodder feeding , it could be managed by putting thatch also .
But it is necessary to be clean the place of the feeding fodder .
Due to having the number of animals more the arrangement of their food has to be done in two rows .
If animals have to be standing in a line , then there is a manger toward the front .
The back wall of the manger would be little high and front wall would be low , thus wile washing the manger water can drain and animal can eat fodder comfortably .
Manger should be made of the bricks and cement .
The place near the manger to stand the animals and the backside drainage , both should be cemented , clearly sloped , thus can be cleaned easily by washing .
The distance between the manger and drainage should be at least five and a half foot .
The urine and dung lying on the floor near the manger should be carried to the pit of the compost by washing and through the drainage .
Behind the drainage there should be the path of four and four and a half foot to bring the fodder etc . and for animals to go .
To tie the animals instead of the rope , iron chains or neck-band should be used .
Because chains and neck-bands could be cleaned by washing it , not to the ropes .
While tieing animals in front of the manger , every two animals should be tied in the seperate parts .
For this after every two animals the iron rods or the wire without prickles or the strong sticks of the wood should be put after every two animals .
While feeding the fodder , cows , buffalos , oxen should be kept separate .
If the tap water can be carried to the animal shed , then taps should be fixed in every manger .
Dactor Sahab said further , if animals are more than the number of eight-ten , then animals will have to be tied in two rows .
In one way , keeping the animals face opposite , second way , putting the animals ' tail opposite .
The way to keep the animals facing each other is cheap , but not good .
Because in this method , while feeding the animals they are stood on both sides of the manger .
Thus , at the time of eating fodder the breath of an animal go to the body of another animal .
In such situation , if any animal will have the infectious disease then it may spread quickly in another animal and then in every animal .
In this method , the other demerit is this that while eating the fodder animals fight among them .
In these fights-quarrels fast-paced animals may injure innocent animals by their horns .
The third drawback of this method is this , that it is very problematic to put the fodder to the animals .
Hence , till how extent it is possible , animals should be tied facing each others tail .
To put the fodder in front of the both mangers itself the four foot path is made .
From a broad canal itself the urine and dungs of the animals of both sides is carried to the pit of the compost .
It is necessary to clean the feeding place at least twice in a day .
The small calves of the cow and buffalo should be given fodder etc . by tying them separate from the big animals .
Pregnant cow and buffalo should be kept separate also .
Not just this , the animals about to die and sick animals also should have a separate place to live and eat .
If there are more animals in the cattle shed and a bull has also been reared in that , than with the staying-eating place for bull a separate big courtyard should be there also .
While finishing today 's meeting Dr. Kapil said , I finish today 's meeting just saying this that while making arrangements for your animals always take care of your animals ' complete comfort .
Its good result will come itself in front of you .
Today was the second day of the conference .
At the right time Doctor Sahab came and started to say , very few people among you would be knowing that in comparison of the other countries our animals are very weak .
They give less milk and also have less power to work .
Most of the animals are always lazy or sick .
This is a biggest reason for this , that at our place animals are not given nutritious food .
Others who are rich , they do n't have knowledge that animals will be healthy from how much and which kind of food .
The nutritious diet is that , in which vitamin , protein , minerals , fat , carbohydrate , fibers and water should be in proper quantity .
All these are the parts of the animal diet , are elements , are portions .
In the fodder-grains , all these are in some extra amount .
The vitamins are very essential for animals in every way .
They prevent animals from many kinds of diseases .
It helps very much to increase the sight of the eyes and to maintain the strength of the teeth .
The pregnant cows-buffalos which give milk gets huge help from vitamins .
Among these vitamins ' A ' and ' D ' is very essential for animals .
Vitamin ' A ' is found in the green grass .
Hence , it is considered very beneficial to feed animals green fodder and green grass , vitamin ' D ' is found in the sunlight .
Hence , to put animals in the open and the places with light is considered good for the health .
Work to make the body strong is done by the protein .
By doing the hard work the body of the animals which does rub down and break , work to fulfill that is of protein .
For the milch and pregnant cows-buffalos the fodder with protein is very essential .
The main agricultural products can be grouped broadly into food , fiber , fuel , raw material , pharmacuticals and stirrings .
Simultaneously , there is a series of decorating or foreign products also .
What is climate- climate is made up of two words water and air .
In Urdu it is called Abhawa .
' Jal ' or ' Aab ' means water and the meaning of ' Vayu ' or ' Hawa ' is obviously air .
That is to say that the word climate is made from the combination of air and water .
Water here refers to rains and the air refers to the air that affects the environment surrounding us .
Sometimes it generates moisture around us and sometimes it generates heat .
Rain also does somewhat a similar work .
This concludes that climate is an object that gives us heat and cool .
We experience both of them ourselves .
But there are such changes also which we experience on our own .
And there are some changes which we do not feel .
All such things are called climate .
Thus the combined impact of the heat , cold , moisture and rains of any place is called climate .
There is an integral relationship between climate and agriculture .
The success and failure of crops depend on this .
Sudden change in climate sometimes leads to great loss in agriculture .
There is a terror of plants getting affected by diseases if the weather during winters remain cloudy continuously for 3-4 days .
It mostly catches Gerui disease , consequently the growth of plant retards .
Extremely cold weather and sudden rainfall destroys crop .
This is to say that climate affects agriculture right from the plowing , sowing , weeding , irrigation , harvesting till the time it reaches home .
Hence it is essential for a successful farmer to begin his work after identifying the climate .
If there are no clouds in the sky then the plants start turning yellow and finally dry .
The crops can tolerate a fixed amount of moisture .
If this moisture suddenly stops and there is no amount of water in the plants then they stop food formation process .
The roots become dry , break and the crop gets destroyed .
The crop growth also stops when the moisture content is more .
The downfall in temperature affects the plant leaves more .
Their veins stop working .
The crops are sown according to the seasons .
Climatic knowledge during those seasons is essential .
There are 6 seasons .
Each of them lasts for two months .
Our year begins from Chaitra , when winter is on the verge of ending and summer begins .
These seasons can be easily identified in the plains of our country .
But there are some parts of this country which are extremely chilly for eight months and some are hot for eight months .
Some have year round rainfall up to 500 inches and places like Rajputana do not even have 5 inches average rainfall .
Our country is very large , tropic of cancer passes through it , it has ocean on three sides and it falls on the way of monsoon winds .
Hence the climate here varies at different places .
The reason is that slanting Sun rays fall on tropic of Cancer .
The Sun shines overhead for four months a year .
It increases the heat during these days but when the Sun enters tropic of Capricorn , the heat impact becomes very less and the weather becomes cool .
The place which will be more close to tropical line will be more hot and less cold and will get heavy rainfall .
But as we go away from the tropical line the situation will be opposite .
That is to say the climate will be more cold , less hot with average rainfall .
And even if we reach the poles there will be year round cold , and sometimes snowfall will also occur .
The Sun will be rarely visible .
If the place falls on the way of monsoon winds then rainfall is possible there but if it does n't fall there then the place becomes barren and deserted .
Rajputana neither falls on the monsoon arising from Bay of Bengal nor Arabian Sea .
Consequently it remains dry .
Similar climate in plains is essential .
Our country is situated between 8 degree and 30 degree northern latitude .
From this point of view our climate should be warm but this is not the situation .
The reason is the soil structure of this place .
Because of different structure of soil , the climate of different places is different .
Yes , the climatic conditions of plains is definitely similar .
If the crops get adequate water on appropriate time then the production is good .
But generally it is seen that there is always a fury of rains all the times in the form of heavy rainfall , less rainfall and untimely rainfall .
It damages a lot of crop .
These three things are harmful for agriculture .
During rainy season due to heavy rainfall the crop get washed away or become rotten .
sometimes it becomes difficult to resolve the problem of seeds .
The fury of drought is all the more dreadful .
The leaves generally get affected by chilly weather and it stops the internal action of leaves .
Because of this the leaves can not make their food and gradually start drying .
Because of extreme chilly weather the crops sometimes bear big losses .
With the help of thermometer temperature calculator we can ascertain chilly weather while before and protect the crops using appropriate measures .
If the crops are irrigated before the arrival of winters then the crops remain unaffected .
Its impact can be forbidden up to a certain extent by ejecting smoke around the farm during winters .
Rain Gauge - It is a hollow instrument .
It has a cone from where rain water enters .
This cone is attached to a glass bottle .
Water gets collected in the bottle through the cone .
The water of the glass is measured with a measuring device .
This instrument is kept in an open place during rainfall so the atmospheric rain directly enters into it .
The water should at least be measured once in every 24 hour .
Such rains are measured in inches .
For example if there 2 inches of water in a measuring glass then the rainfall that day will be called 2 inches only .
Sometimes rainfall occurs at the end of February or first week of March .
It leads to the rotting of collected grains in farms .
The seeds catches a kind of black spot which reduces its rate in market and the taste also becomes bitter .
Thus grains are greatly affected by rains until they reach home .
When there are sudden rains at the end of May after Rabi harvesting they adequately help in summer plowing .
Hence it is clear that rain division is more significant for cultivation than the amount of rainfall .
Untimely rains puts bad impact on crops and sometimes lead to scarcity but timely rains can make the farmers rich .
Firstly all the insects originate in the form of eggs by their parent insect .
Different insects have different kinds of eggs .
These eggs are round , long , triangular etc .
Some eggs are yellow and some are white .
This is to say that eggs have several forms and colors .
Consequently every egg gives rise to long , with many joints , crawling living being which is called kirauna , bhudila , ilat or sunda .
The time of egg hatching is also different .
But it is essential to know that eggs hatch quickly in summers .
Egg hatching delays with increasing cold .
Eggs do not eat nor drink anything but the ' insects that comes out start running here and there in search of food .
These insects eat the soft stem propagation , leaves and fruits when they get time .
You know ' bhalu sunde ' .
It eats the leaves of pigeon pea , kidney bean and urad .
The green insect which is found on the leaves of pumpkin , gourd and nenua eats its leaves .
You will be amazed to know that very soon these insects destroy the entire crop .
That is why the form `` Sunda `` of insects is very furious .
These insects are responsible for destroying your crops .
The gram insects eat the stems of growing plants and destroy the entire crop overnight .
Every insect adds to the generation growth after copulation .
Majority of the male insects die after copulation .
The female insects also face the similar situation .
Majority of the the female insects die because of laying innumerable eggs .
But as opposite to this , queen termite about whom you will learn later lives for 7-8 years giving 70000-80000 eggs everyday .
The entire world is aware of termite insect .
It is prevalent in entire world as compared to other regional insects .
The origin of this insect is also very old .
There is a story of a termite catching a sage 's body in an Indian religious book .
Thus on this basis the age of the insects and the harmful effects that they could have done can be estimated .
Various remedies to curb them are being considered everywhere in the world .
Their attack is seen more on the objects made from wood , chevron , bamboo etc .
There are four kinds of termites in a single burrow .
The termites that destroy the things are called labor termites .
Every labor termite is 1/4th inches tall and light yellow-golden in color .
Eating things and making burrows in soil , collecting soil and building houses outside ground and carrying new egg termites from one place to another is the job of these labor termites .
9-10 millions of termites stay in every burrow and there is a place which is called state home .
The king and queen termite stay in this state home .
The queen termite keeps the new eggs in an orchard near labor termite state home .
This orchard is the growth place for eggs .
It has fungal growth and which is eaten by the new termites coming out of the eggs .
The state home and orchard also has some protecting termites whose work is to protect .
Only seven kinds of tiddi insects in the world have been known so far .
Amongst them India alone has three kinds of tiddis .
These tiddis are not only found in India but also in middle east and central Africa .
The most devastating of these three of tiddis is the one which is called desert tiddi .
In English this insect is called Shistosarka-grigeria .
In India these tiddis are found in the desert of Sindh and Rajasthan .
Outside India they develop and grow in Balochistan etc . also .
The eggs of tiddis are very small yellow and brown in color like rice .
During summers these eggs hatch within 12-14 days .
But during winters they take at least 25-26 days in hatching .

These officers will follow the remedies which I have told you before .
But this does not mean that all the works will be done by the government officers .
You should help them while using every possible remedy .
We believe that controlling tiddi attack is a government affair but all the people of the village should give physical , psychological and monetary help .

Knead the entire hay with this jaggery juice .
Mix ' sodium flausilicate ' in this kneaded thing .
The mixture thus prepared should be neither too dry nor tough or loose .
Then this mixture should be put very early morning into the farm .
This experiment kills majority of the insects .
12-14 ser mixture is adequate for bigha land .
Sodium flausilicate with a moon trademark can be bought from shops selling manure .

Hence it should be used carefully .

The farmers believe that insect enemies come out with this action and it actually happens .
But this success is momentary .
These insects might go out for sometime but they come back to the field .
Hence `` Mangiyana `` is not a successful measure .

The government has encouraged the organized marketing of agricultural products in the country through the network of regulated markets .
Most of the state governments and Union Territories have made laws for the development agricultural goods market .
7,177 markets have been covered under regulation till March , 2002 .
Out of which around 15 % work under regulation sector .
Yet the study says that the establishment of regulated markets have achieved a limited success in providing need based facilities and services in building an able marketing .
There is a lack of required facilities to manage most of the products in regulated markets .
Rural periodic markets generally and tribal markets particularly have remained out of their development area .
Monopoly methods and traditions have stopped the functioning of agricultural marketing through free and competitive trade , use of modern techniques in crop technology and export , agricultural based industries and goods granaries etc .
Enhancing trade competition and providing facilities such as categorization , standardization , storage , financial security , etc have become subsidiary works .
Efficient agricultural marketing facility is required for the development of agricultural sector .
It is essential to have flexible , quick and inclusive marketing structure to face challenges like increasing production , expansion of new technologies , changing social , economical scenario , size of distribution series and increasing demand to reduce the margin between consumer and farmers , consequences emerged due to liberalization and globalization after the due duration of world trade organizations .
The liberalization of agriculture in world trade have provided opportunities to farm sectors to send their agricultural products in world market .
In order to provide market access to agricultural communities , it is essential that the internal agricultural marketing system in the country is united and strengthened .
Currently only state governments under state agricultural marketing regulation act have been given the right to start the process of establishing regulated agricultural markets .
As a result of the process of establishing markets , the private sector can not initiate the establishment markets with best facilities .
The role of the government in this sector should be of a facilitator and not of a market manager or controller .
Essential high level labor skill and more and more capital for the basic structure and management of market can only be obtained from private sectors .
The farmers are encouraged to categorize their agricultural product on farm through direct marketing .
Thus they escape the expense on transportation to bring the product from farm to the regulated market for selling .
The farmers and the buyers also invest very little through direct marketing and it yields good amount of money .
Consequently the result of direct marketing expansion of agricultural products in south Korea lead to 20-30 % decrease in consumer 's price and the producers also received up to 10-20 % more profit .
The warehouse certification in the country should also be started so that along with the amount of product the quality is also certified and these receipts are accepted as the basis for loans .
The loan margin need of agricultural products storage should be reduced .
It is also essential to adopt international level quality management method .
Sorghum has been cultivated in India since ancient times but they were sown for fodder , not for food grain , But now they are sown for food grain also .
Sorghum is cultivated in northern India during Kharif season and during Kharif and rabi both in southern India .
In India it is cultivated at large scale in Rajasthan , Punjab , Haryana , Uttar Pradesh .
Not much sorghum is grown in states like West Bengal , Tamil Nadu etc .
As per official figures in India the acreage of this crop is around 1.25 billion acres .
India is third largest in terms of area under sorghum cultivation .
Maharashtra is the biggest sorghum producing state .
Karnataka and Madhya Pradesh occupy second and third position respectively .
Sorghum seeds contain 10.4 % protein , 1.9 % fibers , 1.6 % minerals and 72 % carbohydrates .
Sorghum contains 1.4-2.4 % of lycin amino acid protein .
Starch is prepared from a special variety of sorghum .
Liquor is also prepared from its seeds .
It is also a best means of providing alcohol .
Apart from green fodder , silage which is a tasty food for cattle is also prepared from sorghum .
Around 12-15 kgs/acre seeds are sown for fodder .
While the cultivation done for getting grains require 8 kgs/ acre seeds .
The grains start growing till end of October .
Its average production is 2.5-3 tonnes /acre .
Sorghum is a crop of warm climate but fast growing species could also be grown during summers in cold regions .
More than 30 degree Celsius temperature at the time of fiber growth can be harmful for the sorghum crop .
6-8 pH value of a land is considered good for the cultivation of sorghum .
There should be good drainage system in the farm .
The farm should be ploughed using cultivator or tiller and leveler should be run .
CSH-5 : This variety gets prepared in 105-110 days .
It prepares 33-35 tonnes /hectare grains and 90-95 tonnes fodder .
The plants are around 175 c.m long .
The corns are long and semi-tied , the size of the grains are small .
CSH-9 : This variety gets prepared in 105-110 days .
36-40 tonnes of grains and 95-100 tonnes/ hectare of fodder are prepared .
Jawahar sorghum : This variety gets prepared in 110-115 days .
The grain production is 3032 tonnes/hectare .
They are appropriate for light less deep land and low rainfall areas .
The seeds should be treated with fungicide and thyrum at the rate of 3 g.m per kg seeds .
10 gm agosprilium and PSB , culture should be used at the rate of per kilogram of seeds after treating the seeds with fungicide medicine .
Sorghum is sown in the month of July .
Sowing should be done keeping a gap of 12-15 c.m between the plants and a gap of 45 c.m between the rows .
There should be 15-17 plants in every square meter .
Dry sowing can be done after receiving information regarding rains .
The dense plants should be pulled out and a certain distance should be kept between the plants .
A healthy plant is kept at a distance of 10-12 c.m while doing rarefaction after sprouting when the plants are 8-10 days old .
Rest all the plants are removed .
Later if there are light showers then another plant can be planted at a place where there are no plants .
Irrigation is very essential after putting manure in sorghum field .
The weeds should be removed after 15-20 days of sowing .
Sorghum fields also get hugely attacked by insects , The various kinds of insects that infect them damage the crops .
If the crops are infected by stem penetrating insect then a solution of 10 gm soap should be sprayed thrice at an interval of 10 days .
Maharashtra crops get hugely infected by meez fly .
The insect attacks when the fibers come out .
The female flies are orange or red in color which lays eggs inside the flowers .
Withing 2-3 days membranes come out of the eggs and destroys the flower testes by eating them .
An average of 40-50 tonnes/hectare grains and 100-125 tonnes dry kadbi are received by doing hybrid sorghum cultivation using advanced methods .
It depends on rains .
Roughly 25-30 tonnes/hectare dry kadbi are received from these areas generally .
Small cardamom is grown from India till Malaysia .
Small green cardamom is used to bring aroma to any edible product .
Their seeds are quite aromatic .
The botanical name of green cardamom is elettaria cardamom .
The plant is bushy and the stem extends till 3 meter .
The flowers appear in white bunches .
Cardamom also appears in bunches .
The flower fruits have three covers which contain seeds .
Mix cardamom in black pepper and ghee and consume it to cure sour belching .
Doing this cures sour belching .
Sometimes we get hiccups which lasts for quite long .
People feel uncomfortable in themselves in such situations .
Cardamom should be immediately put in mouth for getting rid of sudden hiccups .
It immediately gives relief .
People are mostly attacked by heat strokes during summers .
During this season cardamom should be kept inside mouth before going out .
It saves from heat strokes .
Even if someone is attacked by heat then the patient should be immediately given cardamom .
It reduces the effect of heat stroke .
Dream disorder- chew cardamom seeds or dissolve it in milk and drink it at night , Doing this cures dream disorder .

There is an ongoing debate over farming .
Agriculture is the means of livelihood of majority of the people in India .
Despite being marginal farmers some of them get good income through agriculture .
Some farmers are getting good yield despite being in infertile areas .
All this becomes true through hard work and strong will power .
One such farmer is Nand kiashore Jaismeria from Jodhpur district .
He has turned the proverb of getting gold from barren land into reality .
In the beginning they cultivated plums adopting integrated system and now they are earning name in other states through plum nurseries .
For this he has received many honors including N. G. Ranga farmer award .
Around 25 k.m to the north of district headquarters ( Jodhpur ) , behind behind sandy hills , Mankalao village is not considered good for cultivation .
Nand kishore Jaisalmeria lives in village surrounded by sand hills from all sides .
The average rainfall in the area is 365 mm .
The farmers consider it better to engage themselves for earning livelihood in other works rather than agriculture .
The scientists examined the farm soil .
After investigation with the initiative of scientists , with advanced systems , Nand kishore planted plums in his farm .
For the first time 750 saplings were planted .
A responsibility of taking care of these plants in sandy soil was undertaken .
He irrigated each and every plant and took care of them .
some time later these plants grew old and flowers appeared on them .
Nand kishore was utterly happy to see this .
He immediately reached Kajri and informed the scientists about the flowering of plants .
The scientists observed the place and gave techniques to save plum flowers .
Consequently innumerable plums were produced in the farm .
In such a situation , neem , acacia etc . were planted in the farm .
There was double profit from these trees .
Firstly , the farm lines became strong and secondly the trees started providing wood for fuel and fodder permanently after growing old .
This also led to the increase in soil conservation , security and fertility .
Later the woods of these trees also became means of income for them .
Hence cultivation of a single farm , especially selling plums began , the fee was received by giving bee keeping box on rent , wood for fuel was cut from plum and other trees .
Every plum tree started giving 30 kilograms of plums every year .
India is an agriculture dominant country .
Agriculture is the livelihood of around 65-70 % population here .
Almost 65 % work force is engaged into this and currently ( 2010-11 ) agricultural contribution in gross domestic product ( GDP ) is 14.2 % and the share in export is around 16 % .
Its development is not possible without villages .
Wheat , paddy , sugarcane , maize , potatoes , vegetables etc . are major produces here .
The population of the country is ever increasing which was 102.7 billion as per the census of 2001 and is around 121 billion currently while arable land is limited and that is reducing everyday .
Consequently the size of the land holding has reduced to around 0.15 hectare .
Hence in order to increase the food production as per demand , the information regarding advanced agricultural technique is very essential .
The crop experts are fully responsible towards this work .
The agricultural scientists are successfully facing food crisis .
The agricultural crops have been classified into three categories kharif , rabi and zaid as per the seasons .
Major Rabi crops are wheat , mustard , gram , peas , lentils and rapeseed .
Seasonal crops such as -kahu , melon , lady 's finger , cucumber , urad , green gram , cow pea , sunflower etc . can also be grown during Zaid .
Cotton is one of the major fibrous agricultural produce .
They are sown during kharif season and cotton clothes are manufactured from the fibers received from them .
They are primarily grown in black soil , alluvial soil and laterite soil .
The quality of cotton depends of the length , thinness , maturity and uniformity of fibers .
Like other crops it is essential to save cotton also from various diseases ( mlani , mul , enthrekanoz and jhulsa ) and insects ( haral , chitkabri or pink sundi ) so as to get good production .
Oats , lusarn , sorghum , gwar , millet , napier grass and para grass are major fodder crops .
Amongst them barsim , napier and para grass are extremely nutritious .
Water puts a great impact on the plant growth and crop production .
Hence the land should have ample moisture .
This water benefits the crop through multiple chemical , physical and biological processes .
The water moisture absorbing capillary gravitation in soil is found in four forms .
The soil manure is quite significant for profitable production .
Manure increases the fertility of land and supplies essential nutritive elements for the growth of plants .
The essential elements that the plants get from them are nitrogen , phosphorous , potash , calcium , magnesium and sulfur .
The source of potassium are also organic matter and chemical fertilizers .
Calcium , magnesium and sulfur are found in many kinds of compound forms .
The amount of nutritive elements required for these crops are different for different crops and the time of supplying them also varies .
The requirement of nitrogen is more during growth but the requirement of phosphorous is more initially .
Plants absorb potassium from the soil till the crop growth .
Potassium is required in great amount in the beginning for the growth of roots .
Cow dung manure is the best of all manures .
They contain all nutritive elements for the plants but majority of the cow dung is used in the form of fuel in our country .
The nutritive elements of the cow dung that gets collected in heap in small amounts decreases due to rains and sun .
Thus in order to properly collect this manure , the manure is collected in a pit which is called compost .
These days there is a tradition of preparing gobar gas using gobar gas plants .
The appropriate amount of water availability is extremely important for good production .
Rain water is the major source .
But it is uncertain and irregular , therefore the lack of water is supplied through artificial means of irrigation .
Atmospheric moisture , temperature , wind speed , land variety , special weeding of crop , style of sowing and ploughing and land fertility determine the amount of water requirement for the crops .
Accumulation of more than required water leads to hindrance in air circulation because of which harmful salts start accumulating , the temperature of soil decreases , roots become loose , ploughing becomes bad and becomes marshy .
Accumulated water gives birth to various diseases and insects .
The quality of under ground water also varies .
At some places the water is fit for agriculture , while at other places it is saline , sticky or poisonous .
Thus such kind of water should be used for irrigation keeping their quality in mind .
Saline water contains more of NO3 .
Such water can be of both the varieties saline and sweet .
Saline water is harmful for agriculture but sweet water is not .
It is essential to have knowledge about various qualities of crops so as to get more profit and good production .
Advanced varieties have special qualities of giving more production and as a result of their combined contribution , the per unit area agricultural production can be achieved .
Short day plants- If the amount of sun rays during the day is more than the set duration then the botanical growth is more and the plants do not flower .
For example if the maximum time limit is 8 hours then the time period for sun rays should be 8 hours of less than that .
The major kharif crops in this section consist of maize , soybean , sorghum , millet , paddy etc .
They are called C4 plants .
Day neutral plants : The flowering process of plants of this section are not affected by the duration of light .
The flowering happens in both scanty and long sun rays duration such as cotton , sun flower , tomatoes etc .
Cash crops- Which are immediately or directly sold in the market to earn profit such as sugarcane or potatoes , tobacco .
Padology-It is that branch of soil science which considers soil to be purely natural object and the experimental usefulness is not taken care of .
This science is related to the origin and distribution of soil which is known in the study of soil organization , life and mobility .
This science studies the quality , classification , behavior , anatomy and body composition of the soil , it also includes the description of natural powers responsibility of soil preparation .
On the basis of soil examination , the availability of essential nutritive elements in the farm soil can be determined and on the basis of available examination results balanced fertilizer recommendations for the crops are made .
Hence soil examination is extremely important for advanced agriculture .
Fruits and vegetables have special significance in human diet .
His everyday food should essentially include fruits and vegetables because they provide him with vitamin , carbohydrates , salts , iron , calcium and phosphorous which are essential for balanced diet .
Other than food fruits and vegetables are also significant from economic point of view .
Fruit cultivation is more profitable than food grain .
Developed countries also do international trade of fruits .
Further , industries have been set up to make jam , jelly , squash , vinegar , juice , sauce etc . from fruits which are the means of livelihood of many people .
Several kinds of fruits should not be planted together in the orchard but separately .
While making plantation plan one should make sure that various kinds of trees develop properly , it facilitates agricultural work and more and more fruits are planted .
The various popular methods of tree plantation are square size , rectangular , six sided , quinkans and contour .
The growth of trees are also affected by temperature , air , and chilly weather .
Excess heat and fast wind are harmful for them .
Temporary shade from hay or grass is build to protect the plants from scorching heat .
It is essential to plant wind blocking trees surrounding the orchard to protect them strong wind .
The process of making vegetable and fruit plants able to face the chilly weather , hot wind and scorching heat is the process of making them tolerant .
For this it is essential to do minimum irrigation before it dries and they should be left more and more open .
The scarcity of temperature also makes the plants tolerant .
The process of planting the live plant from one place to another is called transplantation .
It is appropriate to do transplantation when the plants are sleeping or are more actively grown .
Transplantation is done to save expensive seeds .
The plants develop roots with many small branches due to trimming of roots because of transplantation and the time between its plantation and growth is saved , Because of this it has become possible to grow the crops even in adverse conditions .
The transplantation should be carefully carried .
After pulling out the plant they should be kept in a shady place and covered with a wet cloth .

Banana is also a significant Indian fruit .

Hot and humid climate is appropriate for them .

Agriculture machinery are chiefly classified in two sections .
The first section consists of those machinery which are run by farmers physical power such as khurpi , phawda the second section consists of those machinery which require animals , diesel engine or tractor power to run such as plow , harrow , cultivator .
The machinery named cultivator is used to make the soil soft .
It is useful in destroying weeds , mixing manure to the field and preparing the field for sowing .
The major varieties are Kanpur , Vahvah , shabas etc .
Another useful machinery is harrow .
Like cultivator , harrow also pulls out weeds from the tilled field , makes the soil soft and is helpful in plucking the tough land of the sown field .
Field plowing has special significance in agricultural methods .
Plowing is done from outside to inside or from inside to outside in the field .
Transmission of power is the process of sending power to any engine or electric motor etc . to the source that runs it .
Easily accessible conventional tracks are used to run farm machines .
The tracks are made of strong and flexible element and are put on two and more dhirnis .
They are made from rubber , leather or cotton and are strong .
The farmers of our country generally cut the crops using hand cutters .
The need for advanced equipment for agriculture is ever increasing along with industrial development .
Hence for harvesting the use of reaper and combine harvester at the place of darate is increasing which can be pull from both bullocks and tractors .
The next job after crop harvesting is of `` Lank ki Madai `` in the field .
It is extremely important to use agricultural equipment in order to increase agricultural production .
These agricultural equipment are run through two kinds of energy .
These days paddy is sown using `` zero till `` machine which does good work at low cost .
Chilled cast iron is more tough as compared to other kinds of iron and the iron layers made from them are naturally sharp due to upper friction .
Domestic plow makes a kund of ' V ' size which leaves land between two kunds and in order to plow them line plowing becomes essential .
An equipment named Bakkhar is also popular in Bhognipur tehsil of Kanpur district apart from Bundelkhand .
It is a second land finishing equipment .
Patela is also known as Pata , Suhaga , Sarawan or Haenga .
Dhenkli is one of the ancient method of pulling out water from wells , ponds and canals , It is used at such places where it is not possible to put any stable equipment .
All the processes carried with an objective to prepare land for sowing and making the land weed free and loose during crop growth is known as land finishing .
Indigenous plow is a multipurpose equipment for Indian farmers .
Guniya is a useful equipment to make signs on wood .
Basula is a major equipment of rural carpenter which is used by him in daily works .
Six kinds of retis , flat , semi circular , triangular , round and hand are used .
The work of Jambur is to pull out the nail from the wood .
Ari is an equipment to cut wood .

Agricultural economy emerged in the form of economic branch which studies the economic processes and economic policies of farmer community .
Hence agricultural economic science is an aspect of economic science and secondly it is a special branch of agricultural science .
Agricultural science is that science which uses economic theories and methods in special conditions of agricultural industry .
These means can be used in various ways to fulfill many kinds of requirements and achieving various objectives .
India was previously a lagging country in agricultural production .
The major reasons are- small holdings , sub division of holdings , dependence on monsoon , epidemic of floods and famine , inappropriate and conventional agricultural methods , illiteracy of farmers , poverty etc .
Many remedies have been done and are being done by the government after independence .
Which has increased agricultural production .
The government is running various educational programs to remove illiteracy .
There are various kinds of geographical and economic conditions in various parts of the country .
Hence a similar kind of educational method is not prevalent in the entire country .
Various kids of educational methods as per the regional situation are being adopted such as -rainy agriculture , humid agriculture , irrigated agriculture , dry agriculture and jhooming agricultural method .
An organ of agricultural economy in India is agricultural labor .
They are those people who work on other people 's land and get a part of crop or money for their services .
They have no right to take any decision related to the land or the crops grown on the land .
Their number in India is ever increasing .
Zamindari System- Under this a single person is the master of the land of one or more villages and he is called the zamindar .
He is in charge of getting land tax from the farmers and submit them in the royal treasure .
The British rulers gave the authority of the land to some British followers and made a sacrifice of the interest of billions of farmers who plowed the field because of which they had to be dependent on the mercy of Zamindars .
Zamindari system was also abolished through the regulations passed in states like Rajasthan , Madhya Pradesh etc .
Only then the creative work of agriculture began .
controlled markets have been established with the objective to improve the condition of agricultural produce marketing .
The buyers and sellers of the committees of these markets are given full representation and their organization and functioning is done as per the rules framed under the rules of the act .

animal rearing is that branch of behavioral science which tells about the art of economically keeping the animals fit .

Around 31 % part of the total annual income of our country is received through animal wealth .
The total G.D.P . contribution of animal wealth and fisheries in the year 2008-09 was 4.07 % .
We get useful products such as milk , flesh , wool , eggs , leather , manure , hair etc . from animals .
animals are used in agricultural works such as plowing , irrigation and loading goods .
Under various five year plans in the country consistent efforts are being made to improve animal breed , growth in milk production , flesh , wool and eggs .
Research workshops are being held at many places in the country and after the testing beneficial facts are being told to those who rear animals .
The Central government established National Dairy Research Institute , NDRI in Karnal ( Harnal ) in 1955 , This institutions makes discoveries of new information in the field of cattle rearing and milk production and spreads them to the farmers via telecasting .

50-55 % of the milk production in the country is received through buffaloes only but the area of cow reform through breeding is more expansive as compared to buffaloes .
the cows of other section fulfill dual objectives which implies that they give good amount of milk as well as their bulls are good for agricultural work.Its varieties are Haryana , kokrez , tharparkar ( safed sindhi ) , kosi or mewati , angol , gowlao , nimadi , gangatiri or shahabadi and krishna ghati etc .

It is well known that the milk production of foreign breed of cows is much more than the cows of our country .
The major domestic breeds of cows are hybrid frigian , brown swiss , red den , aayar shayar garnsi red pole and short horn .
The hybrid variety of cows made pregnant from them give more milk .
The major hybrid variety of cows are Jarsindh , karan swiss and karan fry .
The milk production of hybrid cows is obviously more and they also become mature soon and start giving milk as compared to domestic cows .
The major objective of sheep rearing is to get wool .
Apart from wool , the country earns 28 billion every year through the flesh , milk , leather and and dung of sheep .
Our country gets an average of 675 grams wool every year from sheep .
Indian sheep have been primarily divided into two sections .
The first category consists of sheep with wool and the second category consists of sheep with hair .
There are two major breeds of sheep with hair , mandila and nellore . These sheep have less of wool and more of hairs .
The female sheep and goats mate after 18-21 days for 72 hours .
Their gestation period generally lasts for 150 days .
The male sheep are emasculated after 1-2 months for getting good quality of meat .
Looking at the increasing demand and less production of eggs and meat in the country the Indian government is paying attention to the development of poultry farming .
The poultry farming business can be initiated with lost cost and more and more profit can be achieved .

Apart from pulses they can be easily taken from eggs .
The weight of a standard size of egg is 50-60 grams .
Hen takes less time and begin to lay eggs in around 6 months .
When hens are reared for meat then they take even lesser time and get ready in around 1.5-2 months .
The process of making eggs in the genitals and hatching takes around 24 hours .
The process of coming out of the baby from the eggs takes places naturally and also by a artificial technique using an incubator .

Milk has a special significance .
The milk adulteration is measured through lactometer .
The relative density is determined through lactometer .
The relative density of cow 's pure milk is 1.028 at 60 degree F while the relative density of buffalo 's milk is 1.032 .
The number of bacteria is present in the milk developed in our country is huge .
Despite total information regarding clean milk production of the people engaged in milk business , the milk gets contaminated .
Milking is also an art .
The objective of milking is to get all the milk from the breast .
The success of dairy business depends a lot on the milking technique .
The work of milking is mostly done using hands in our country .
Milking is also done using machines but its use is restricted to big milk industries .
Milking using hands is more prevalent in the country .
there are three major methods of milking using hands- 1 , milking by bending the thumb , 2 , pinching technique , 3 , total hand milking , Total hand milking technique is the best technique from scientific point of view .
The age of the farm animals is quite significant for the buyers and sellers of cattle .
The age of the animal can be determined by seeing the structure , horns , nails , records and teeth conditions .
The total sum of all kinds of teeth of cows-buffaloes , sheep is 32 .
The teeth covered by the front teeth are called Incisors .
In cows-buffaloes , sheep etc . they are present only in lower jaw .
When the animals get all kinds of teeth permanently then this stage is called `` full mouth `` .
The age of the cattle can also be determined by the rings made on their horns .
The first ring appears on the cattle horn when they are three years of age .
Then after every year a new ring appears .
The formula of determining cattle age is -- cattle age= number of rings+2 .
In today 's modern and scientific age , only the artificial method of animal breding is adopted .
Rural people are also understanding the significance of artificial fertilization .
Under this method the sperms of male animal is sent to the genital organs of female at proper time and place using machines .
This kind of method helps in improving the breed .
The first artificial fertilization in India was set up in 1939 in Mysore by Dr. Sammat Kumaran .
The knowledge of which elements and what amount of elements should be fed to the cattle is essential for successful cattle rearing .
Then only the cattle keeper can get good production from the animals and can prepare powerful animals able to bear weights .
The animals consistently require food elements and energy for bodily growth and works such as breathing , digestion , milk ejection etc . and also to remain alive .
Like humans animals also need salts , mineral salts and vitamins .
Salts , mineral salts do not accumulate in the body , they come out in the form of urine or sweat .
Hence their regular supply should be fixed , Similarly some other mineral salts such as calcium phosphorous etc . are also essential for the building of bones and teeth .
Therefore the elderly animals should be regularly given 60 grams of salt and 30 grams of bone meal or khadia .
Vitamins are a kind of life elements .
They have significant contribution in functioning of almost all the bodily processes .
Diseases occur in a scarcity of any single vitamin .
Every organ of animal body whether external or internal has a different function .
The determination of whether the animal is good or bad is done on the basis of the structure and functioning of these organs .
Hence the external bodily structure of an animal has integral relationship with its bodily functions .
For example chest , big circle on chest , development of lungs and heart express that .
Similarly slanting back of bulls with quick walking and running are considered good while the best quality of milking cow should have plain back .
The common temperature of animal , pulse rate and breathing rate signifies its complete health .
The differences symbolizes animal 's ill heath or uncommonness .
The common temperature of cows-buffaloes should be 101.5 degree F and that of sheep-goats should be 103 degree F .
The common pulse rate of cows and buffaloes is 40-60/min and that of sheep and goats is 65-85/min .
Similarly the respiration rate of cows and buffaloes is 12-18/min and that of sheep and goats is 12-20/min .
The animals are majorly infected by contagious diseases .
Majority of the diseases spread by microbes such as bacteria , virus , fungus and protozoa .
The cattle keepers should carefully take measure to save their animals from these diseases .
Prevention is better than cure otherwise it become difficult to treat when the animal catches disease .
In order to prevent from the disease firstly the diseased animal should be kept away from the healthy animals so that the disease does not catch other animals , The animals should be regularly given different kinds of vaccines .
Hence there are two kinds of medicines for various diseases .
In the first category the medicines are used internally in the animal 's body and in the second category the medicines are used externally .
Internally the animal is given medicine in the form of tablets , capsules , syrup , liquid , sauce , chyle etc .
I order to get quick effects of medicine the medicine is supplied in the form of injection .
Externally the animals are given medicine by putting ointment or powder on the wound or by dressing it , bathing the animal in a solution of medicine , plaster and oil massage .

The role of women in cattle rearing and dairy industry is 71 % of total labor force .

Development of rhizo bacteria ' Fomes Lamoensis ' for the growth of tea plants .
